intro: Diosma acuta, commonly known as the acute diosma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Diosma acuta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
